alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Charleston, Colleton, Dorchester and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Summerville, Walterboro, Yemassee, Givhans Ferry State Park, Cottageville, Ritter, Round O, Green Pond, Ashepoo, Hendersonville, White Hall, Jacksonboro, Givhans, Delemar Crossroads, Islandton, Early Branch, Cummings, Knightsville, Almeda Intersection and Thayer.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
